question: Reaction: $CH_3-CH=CH-CH_2OH \xrightarrow{PCC} CH_3-CH=CH-CHO$. Hybridisation change involved at C-1 in the above reaction:
explanation: Reactant: Carbon-1 is in $-CH_2OH$. It has 4 sigma bonds (2H, 1C, 1O), so it is $sp^3$.
Product: Carbon-1 is in $-CHO$ (Aldehyde). It has 3 sigma bonds (1H, 1C, 1O) and 1 pi bond, so it is $sp^2$.
